data.title: Console part 2 callbacks and auit
data.body:
Ok, this is kinda a big PR.  Because the AUIT and the console callback refactor are so intertwined I wasn't able to separate them into different PR's.

I emailed Dan the user manual for the AUIT.  Winterleaf Entertainment L.L.C. is releasing all the documentation and source code to the MIT project.

Let me know if you find any issues

data.title: vehicleMap remapping gui mising
data.body: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/3082bb3adc75134dc4cba2e1787b8ec838771ed5/Templates/Full/game/scripts/client/default.bind.cs#L727 should be exposed for remapping via gui just like the moveMap

data.title: terrain lines in the fog
data.body:
![screenshot_025-00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2813538/5098611/76f44756-6f56-11e4-9c31-a23f509658f9.png)

its the zfighting on the fog distance at the view range cut off. flickers when you move about

data.title: Occlussion stall guard
Make Trigger friendlier towards inheritance
data.body:
Specifically:
- Made update bits constants protected so that derived classes can
  use them - especially NextFreeMask! IIRC, most classes make these
  constants public, though there's no real reason to.
- Made potentialEnterObject virtual so that derived classes can
  substitute their own logic.

This is desirable because I've found that Trigger is nice for doing AI with, but at the moment you can't make a subclass that does anything useful. This would support adding a new class that inherits from Trigger but has AI-specific features.

data.title: Cannot set the resolution in windowed mode
data.body: Setting the resolution in windows mode doesn't work at the higher resolutions. Try setting it to the full resolution of the desktop while in windowed mode. It doesn't work unless you go fullscreen and then alt-enter out of it.

data.title: Looking up actually looks down
data.body:
Possibly an issue with stock animations. When you look all the way up, other clients see the soldier looking down.

![](http://i.imgur.com/UgfwTtR.png)

data.title: Postfx shutoffs
Compilation issues VS2010 and VS2013
data.body:
Visual Studio 2012 compiles fine but i'm having some issues with Visual Studio 2010 and 2013. Ideally id like to use 2013 but since it wasn't work I tired the others.

Visual Studio 2010 I receive link error LNK2038 mismatch detected for '_ITERATOR_DEBUG_LEVEL': value '2' doesn't match value '0'.

Visual Studio 2013 I receive link error LNK1104 cannot open file _DEBUG.exe.

Any idea what the problem is?

data.title: Looking inside a portaled zone from another broken
data.body: When inside a zone looking out through the portal into another zone through its portal doesnt work as it should. The zone youre looking into doesnt render the objects inside.

data.title: MissionMarker is a ShapeBase
data.body: This should probably not be the case. Should we introduce new custom marker classes? What about users (for example, the UAISK) who rely on being able to set custom shapes for their spawn markers?

milestone.title: OpenGL3
milestone.description:
This milestone tracks the progress of adding an OpenGL rendering backend to the engine alongside the current DirectX backend, which is unfortunately the only backend of the abstracted GFX interface. This will allow OpenGL rendering on multiple platforms, but specifically OXS and Linux.

[Working branch.](https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/dev_linux_opengl)

data.body: Remove GFXDevice::disableShader becouse we are going to remove Fixed Function Pipeline and we need a shader for render.

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.
